title: owncloud hangs after a short while of syncing
body:
i wanted to exchange data between the two computers, so i added a certain folder to the desktop sync on both machines. on my netbook, the folder is rather small, while on the desktop it is large (containing about 30k files and about 600mb of data). it appears the small folder was synced to my server, but the large sync never finishes. however, the netbook also never downloads the partially synced data.

update: i compressed / archived lots of the files in the desktop folder, so the count is down to 1.5k. but still the sync and webinterface hang after a while, apparently while the client was issuing propfinds.

### expected behaviour
owncloud should sync the folder completely and not hang somewhere

### actual behaviour
owncloud (client sync and web interface) hangs. the client does not finish syncing, and the web interface does not respond at all (server timeout). the apache access log reports that, after a while of activity, no dav requests are being issued, and that no regular http requests are received either. the error logs show nothing. neither the server nor the 2 clients report any significant network traffic. dmesg shows no crashes or other issues.

### steps to reproduce
no idea, didn't try. i have only one server.

### server configuration
operating system: gentoo/linux kernel 3.2.35-hardened-r1
web server: apache 2.2.23
database: mysql 5.1.66
php version: 5.3.18 / suhosin 0.9.33
owncloud version: 4.5.5

### client configuration
browser: chrome 24

operating system:
desktop: gentoo/linux kernel 3.7.1-gentoo
netbook: ubuntu precise 12.04

### logs
#### web server error log
file is empty.

#### owncloud log (data/owncloud.log)
does not exist.

#### browser log
i have none.

please give me instructions how to provide better logs / how to debug this.
